titles.title: Guam Foreign Investment Equity Act
Guam Foreign Investment Equity Act
Guam Foreign Investment Equity Act
To provide for the determination of withholding tax rates under the Guam income tax.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

action.text: Reported by the Committee on Resources. H. Rept. 107-48.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 31.

action.text: Mr. Hefley moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 309.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Hearings held.

committee.name: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

calendar.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

committee.name: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

action.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported by Senator Bingaman without amendment. With written report No. 107-173.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 438.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 4/24/2001--Reported to House without amendment. Guam Foreign Investment Equity Act - Amends the Organic Act of Guam to apply, with an exception for rebated taxes to a Guam payor, Internal Revenue Code tax rates (respecting nonresident aliens, foreign corporations not connected with U.S. business, branch profits, foreign tax-exempt organizations, withholding on nonresident aliens, on foreign corporations, on dispositions of U.S. real property interests, and on partners' share of effectively connected income) to income from sources in Guam as if Guam were treated as part of the United States for treaty purposes.Defines "Guam payor" as the person from whom the income item would be deemed to be received for purposes of claiming treaty rights were Guam treated as part of the United States.
